Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of visa officer's decision
Governing_Law: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate analysis of best interests of children, including Alexsey's serious health condition
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate compelling humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Legal_Rule: Best interests of children must be considered; extrinsic evidence must be disclosed for procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient consideration of children's best interests, breach of procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach due to failure to disclose evidence
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of H&C application based on inadequate reasoning and lack of procedural fairness
Court_Result: Case remanded for re-determination by different visa officer
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Governing_Rule: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
